conversion_verification.notes: The 3D render clearly shows walls with height and thickness, a perceptible interior volume, an angled view, and a cleanly removed roof/ceiling.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Excellent demonstration of 3D conversion fundamentals. Walls have height and thickness, floors are distinct, interior volume is clear, and corner geometry is proper. The view is angled and provides an elevated perspective. The cutaway is clean.

geometric_accuracy.notes: The room configuration, adjacencies, and proportions are very well preserved. Major wall positions and lengths align closely with the 2D plan. Doors are mostly in correct positions, but some windows present in the 3D render are not explicitly marked in the 2D plan, particularly in bedrooms.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture, kitchen elements, and bathroom fixtures are all present and placed in correct rooms with reasonable scale and logical orientation. The furniture style is simplified but serves its purpose of defining space identity.

visual_clarity.notes: The structural clarity is excellent, with clearly distinguishable walls, floors, and openings. Interior is well-lit and visible. Material usage is consistent, and there are no major rendering artifacts. The background is clean and aids presentation, though there are no explicit scores for text labels in the 3D image, so assuming 2D image text labels are not penalized here.

summary: The 3D render is an excellent and geometrically faithful conversion of the 2D floor plan, demonstrating strong foundational 3D conversion, high geometric accuracy, and clear visual presentation.
